headline: Metagenomics
audience: Undergraduate student, Postgraduate taught student, Postgraduate research student, Researcher, Clinician, Industry, Public sector, Research Software Engineer, Bioinformatican, Research skills educator
competencyRequired: Bioscience: Understanding of microbiomes, Bioscience: Understanding of molecular evolution
creditText: Buenabad-Chavez, J., Cansdale, A., Chong, J., Forrester, S., Greeves, E., & Rand, E. (2022). Cloud-SPAN Metagenomics Course: Overview (Version 1.0.0) [Computer software]. https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.7505859
description: Learn to assemble, quality-check, and bin metagenomes into MAGs, assign taxonomy, calculate diversity, and perform functional annotation using mock microbial community data. No prior bioinformatics experience required; basic microbiome knowledge recommended.
funding: Cloud-SPAN. Funded by the UKRI Innovation Scholars (MR/V038680/1)
keywords: data import, programming, AWS, EC2, virtual machine, cloud computing, bioinformatics, data processing, metagenomics, HPC, QC, binning, taxonomy, annotation, bash, Linux, biological research, reproducibility, Metagenome assembly, Taxonomic assignment, Flye, Long reads, FASTQ, Pavion, Krona

headline: Metagenomics for Environmental Scientists
audience: Bioinformatican, Researcher, Postgraduate taught student, Postgraduate research student, Industry, Research Software Engineer, Research skills educator, Public sector, Undergraduate student
competencyRequired: Bioscience: Understanding of metagenomes, Bioscience: Understanding of microbial taxonomy, Bioscience: Understanding of functional annotation, Bioscience: Understanding of microbiomes, Bioscience: Understanding of whole genome sequencing techniques, Bioscience: Understanding of amplicon sequencing techniques, Bioscience: Understanding of genomes, Bioscience: Understanding of molecular evolution
creditText: Buenabad-Chavez, J., Cansdale, A., Chong, J., Forrester, S., Greeves, E., & Rand, E. (2024). Cloud-SPAN Metagenomics Course (2024 version, Environmental Applications) (Version 1.0.0) [Computer software]. https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.12700160
description: Learn to assemble, quality-check, and bin metagenomes into MAGs, assign taxonomy, calculate diversity, and perform functional annotation using real soil microbial community data. No prior bioinformatics experience required; basic microbiome knowledge recommended.
funding: Cloud-SPAN. Funded by the UKRI Innovation Scholars (MR/V038680/1), Natural Environment Research Council (NE/X006999/1, E/Y003527/1).
isBasedOn:
Buenabad-Chavez, J., Cansdale, A., Chong, J., Forrester, S., Greeves, E., & Rand, E. (2022). Cloud-SPAN Prenomics Course (Version 0.1.0) [Computer software]. https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.6354056
Buenabad-Chavez, J., Cansdale, A., Chong, J., Forrester, S., Greeves, E., & Rand, E. (2022). Cloud-SPAN Metagenomics Course: Overview (Version 1.0.0) [Computer software]. https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.7505859
keywords: metagenomics, environmental science, HPC, QC, binning, taxonomy, annotation, bash, Linux, cloud computing, bioinformatics, data visualisation, RStudio, R, data import, programming, AWS, EC2, data processing, biological research, reproducibility, experimental design, data summarisation, statistics, Metagenome assembly
teaches: Bioinformatics: Understanding of metagenome assembly, Bioinformatics: Understanding of metagenome binning, Bioinformatics: Understanding of taxonomic assignment, Bioinformatics: Understanding of functional annotation, Bioinformatics: Understanding of microbial diversity analysis, Command line: Ability to open a shell such as bash, Command line: Ability to navigate filesystems from the command line, "Command line: Ability to move, delete, create and copy files and directories from command line", Command line: Ability to use common command line functions, Command line: Ability to specify inputs and outputs for software from command line, Command line: Ability to login to remote systems from the command line, Command line: Ability to move files between local and remote systems from the command line, High Performance Computing: Ability to utilize cloud computing resources for data analysis, Experimental Design: Understanding of experimental design principles in metagenomics, Computing: Understanding of hierarchical filesystems including root and home directories, "Computing: Understanding working directories, relative and absolute paths", Data management: Ability to document and share data analysis workflows, Data management: Understanding of data integrity and quality control in bioinformatics, Data management: Ability to use version control systems for data analysis projects

audience: Undergraduate student, Postgraduate taught student, Postgraduate research student, Researcher, Clinician, Industry, Public sector, Research Software Engineer, Bioinformatican, Research skills educator

headline: Image Analysis for Microscopy
audience: Bioinformatican, Postgraduate research student, Postgraduate taught student
